intro: Guyonia intermedia, commonly known as the African violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its botanical features include fleshy, velvety leaves and a short, fibrous root system. Guyonia intermedia is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its adaptability and ornamental value.
